title: Matteo Renzi
summary: Matteo Renzi, OMRI (Italian pronunciation: [matˈtɛːo ˈrɛntsi]; born 11 January 1975) is an Italian politician who served as Prime Minister of Italy from 2014 to 2016. He has been a Senator for Florence since 2018.[1][2] Renzi has been described as a centrist and as a liberal by political observers.[3] Renzi has served as the leader of Italia Viva since 2019, having been the Secretary of the Democratic Party from 2013 to 2018, with a brief interruption in 2017.
